abstract: Configures the navigation bar items for this view.

declaration.code: nonisolated func navigationBarItems<T>(trailing: T) -> some View where T : View

overview:
## Discussion

Use `navigationBarItems(trailing:)` to add navigation bar items to the trailing edge of the navigation bar for this view. This modifier only takes effect when this view is inside of and visible within a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/NavigationView].

The example below adds buttons to the trailing edge of the button area of the navigation view:

items.description: Sets the title in the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarTitle(_:)

items.description: Sets the title and display mode in the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarTitle(_:displayMode:)

items.description: Sets the navigation bar items for this view.
items.name: navigationBarItems(leading:)

items.description: Sets the navigation bar items for this view.
items.name: navigationBarItems(leading:trailing:)

items.description: Hides the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarHidden(_:)

items.description: Sets the visibility of the status bar.
items.name: statusBar(hidden:)

items.description: Adds a context menu to the view.
items.name: contextMenu(_:)

title: navigationBarItems(trailing:)
